passages.text: Consumer | Global Beverages

We highlight key takeaways from Pernod Ricard's (not covered) FY25 earnings release, through June 30th, given reads for both Brown- Forman and Diageo. Similar to Diageo, Pernod shared that U.S. results were impacted by subdued consumer confidence and prolonged tariff uncertainty while China results were impacted by continued weak consumer sentiment - see slides in the appendix. Importantly, Pernod noted that the U.S. market is not favorable to pricing and does not anticipate price increases in response to tariffs, a possible benefit for Brown- Forman. FY25 organic net sales declined \(- 3\%\) \((+1\%\) excluding the U.S. and China), while volumes recovered to \(+2\%\) . The firm reiterated its guidance for FY26 to be a "transition year," with improving organic net sales trends skewed to F2H26. F1Q26 expected to be in decline due to numerous headwinds, including distributor inventory adjustments in the U.S., soft consumer demand and inventory adjustments in China, excise policy changes in India, and Cognac sales in Duty Free China only resuming in F2Q. The firm further reiterated its medium- term outlook of \(+3 - 6\%\) for FY27- 29, implemented at half- year results in February and lowered from \(+4 - 7\%\) previously. Key takeaways and slides below:

FY26 expected to be a "transition year" with improving organic net sales, skewed to F2H26; Medium- term outlook for FY27- 29 projects organic net sales growth of \(+3 - 6\%\) p.a. on average, with annual organic OM% expansion

Decline expected in F1Q26 due to:  - Distributor inventory adjustments in the U.S.  - Continued soft consumer demand and inventory adjustments in China  - Impact of excise policy changes in India, skewed towards F1Q  - Sales of Cognac in Duty Free China only resuming from F2Q  - FX impact expected to be significantly negative  - Expect inflation to impact COGS, especially for "wet goods" including young whiskeys  - Prioritizing U.S. in A&P through sharper allocation  - Expect to triple RTD footprint in the U.S. over the next 3 years  - Increasing Gen Z consumption of beverage alcohol - see slides below  - "Strongly believe" moderation is driven by economic moderation and purchasing power as well as premiumization, with frequency down but value up in those occasions  - FY25 organic net sales \(- 3.0\%\) , with declines in China, the U.S., and GTR Asia negatively impacting mix; Continued volume recovery at \(+2\%\) , with three consecutive semesters of volume growth  - Many markets resilient growth, maintaining or gaining share in 12 of 17 top markets  - Group organic net sales \(+1\%\) ex- U.S. and China  - Americas ex- U.S. \(+2\%\) , Europe ex- Russia flat, and ROW and Asia ex- China \(+3\%\)  - Fully lapped exit in Russia now

Please see the analyst certification and important disclosures on page 2 of this report. Evercore ISI and affiliates do and seek to do business with companies covered in its research reports. Investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. © 2025. Evercore Group L.L.C. All rights reserved.

- U.S. org sales -6% in FY25; Spirits market including RTDs in slight growth, impacted by subdued consumer confidence and economic moderation; Expect solid performance across October-December driven by activations and innovation pipeline

- Spirits ex-RTDs in slight decline, with only Tequila growing outside RTDs    
- Irish Whiskey back to growth recently- Still underperforming the market, but sell-out volume and value gap-to-market narrowing, reflecting focus on execution and investment behind brands- Prolonged tariff uncertainty impacted distributor inventory level at year-end, with adjustments expected throughout FY26, particularly in F1Q26    
- Shipped ahead of tariff settlements to not take risk; Now adjusting to normal levels- Don't see any price increase linked to tariff implementation as the environment is not favorable to pricing in the U.S.    
- Perception that prices are high is impacting consumer habits, including the on-trade- Jameson, Absolut, and Kahlua each performing ahead of competitive set    
- Jameson significantly improving and posted positive sell-out in F4Q- Revised RTM implemented over summer to align and increase executional capabilities
- China org sales -21% in FY25, which was "as expected;" Macro environment is still challenging and impacted by weak consumer sentiment; Strong decline expected in F1Q
- Conclusion of the antidumping investigation, which lasted exactly 18 months, with a mutually agreed agreement came into effect on July 5th

- Led to distributor inventory overhang at year-end and some degree of adjustments in F1Q, with a strong decline in China expected    
- Slightly elevated inventory at the end of June

- Underlying performance and consumer confidence did not improve in F4Q    
- Linked to the reminder on restrictions on official entertainment in mid-May    
- Ban was implemented in 2013 and never repealed; Official reminder issued in May
- Sales declines in Martell and Scotch
- Increasing penetration of Premium Spirits among growing middle class
- India org sales +6% in FY25, with strong underlying consumer demand and premiumization trends; Expect "strong growth momentum" in FY26
- Disposal of Imperial Blue expected to be immediately accretive to margins and growth
- Brand "no longer had a strategic fit" in the portfolio
- Excise policy changes in Maharashtra state expected to negatively impact sales in FY26, most significantly in F1Q
- Maharashtra one of the company's "top states in India"
- Excise increased 50% from 300% to 450%; Implemented in mid-July
- India is Pernod's second largest market from a top-line perspective; ~25M additional LDA consumers every year for the foreseeable future, and the market is premiumizing
Travel retail \(- 13\%\) in FY25, with gradual improvement in outlook expected with the resolution of the Cognac suspension in China; Expected to return to growth in FY26

Expecting strong declination in F1G, driven by high comparison, with F2Q to benefit from resumption of sales of Martell in China Duty Free  - Suspension of cognac imports in China Duty Free since December 2024  - Asia also negatively impacted by weakness in South Korea and Taiwan markets  - Europe and Americas are in growth
Europe flat ex- Russia in FY25; "Resilient," with Eastern Europe "dynamic" and Western Europe seeing growth in France
Growth in France but declines in Germany and Spain  - Gaining market share in France and Germany and maintaining share in the U.K.
Brazil good growth, gaining market share
Growth for Beefeater, Royal Salute, Chivas Regal, and Absolut
Please see selected slides below on consumer confidence, moderation, Gen Z trends, and tariffs
Weakened consumer confidence in key markets of US and China
Recent inflation² still impacting consumer behaviour
Source: Company presentation

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:
Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
In- Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.

Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances.

Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
Evercore ISI rating (as of 08/28/2025)
